channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AL

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-27
  • City: MADISON
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS REFUSED BY RECIPIENT BECAUSE BOTTOM OF PACKAGE IS DAMP. BOX WAS PUT IN DRUM UPON ARRIVAL TO STATION. DescribePack: TWO OF THE FOUR LITER BOTTLES HAVE LOOSE CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: TAKEN TO Q.A. AND THEN BOX WAS PUT IN HAZMAT DRUM.

item.title: Report E-2023120330
item.description:
Report E-2023120330

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-22T18:12:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While loading the 3rd compartment of 1450 gallons, Driver was nearly finished when trailer domed out and sprayed fuel from the top. An estimated 25 gallons spilled. It was all captured in the loading bay drain and no cleanup necessary and released by Blendstar. He had previously unloaded at Chevron, same product and customer of straight load of Ethanol. He estimates he left 25-50 gallons within the compartment, claiming that the product drains too slow at the end.
